docs.lead_paragraph: No one questions Chris Algieri's toughness, not after he got up from two first round knockdowns and fought half-blinded the rest of the way to somehow pull out a decision win in his June title fight with the feared Ruslan Provodnikov.

headline.main: Algieri Hopes to Be Rocky Story Against Pacquiao
headline.print_headline: Algieri Hopes to Be Rocky Story Against Pacquiao

docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the World Health Organization refused Wednesday to respond to criticism about the U.N. agency's performance in containing the Ebola outbreak, saying the focus now should be on helping countries contain it.

headline.main: WHO Chief Promises Transparency in Ebola Review
headline.print_headline: WHO Chief Promises Transparency in Ebola Review

docs.snippet: The head of the World Health Organization refused Wednesday to respond to criticism about the U.N. agency's performance in containing the Ebola outbreak, saying the focus now should be on helping countries contain it.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 170 governments pledged Wednesday to do more to prevent malnutrition around the globe, adopting voluntary guidelines to promote healthy diets and reduce levels of obesity at the start of a three-day U.N. conference.

headline.main: Governments Pledge More to Prevent Malnutrition
headline.print_headline: Governments Pledge More to Prevent Malnutrition

docs.snippet: More than 170 governments pledged Wednesday to do more to prevent malnutrition around the globe, adopting voluntary guidelines to promote healthy diets and reduce levels of obesity at the start of a three-day U.N. conference.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers are optimistic about recent efforts to delay the effects of aging and, perhaps, extend life spans.

headline.main: Science (and Quacks) vs. the Aging Process
headline.print_headline: Science (and Quacks) vs. the Aging Process

docs.abstract: Scientific community is optimistic about efforts to improve longevity, but warns against spending money on products that offer fantastic claims; researchers say, while they are not able to stop or reverse aging, they can slow rate at which people get old and keep people healthier longer.
docs.snippet: Researchers are optimistic about recent efforts to delay the effects of aging and, perhaps, extend life spans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many people over age 65 lack dental insurance, a benefit that isn’t covered by traditional Medicare, and those eligible for Medicaid have limited coverage, depending on where they live.
docs.abstract: Older Americans face problem of paying out of pocket for dental care since many people over 65 lack dental insurance; federal Medicare program does not cover routine dental care or dentures, and many Medicare managed care plans offer limited coverage.
docs.snippet: Many people over age 65 lack dental insurance, a benefit that isn’t covered by traditional Medicare, and those eligible for Medicaid have limited coverage, depending on where they live.

docs.lead_paragraph: Algieri, a 30-year-old former kickboxer who once pondered retirement, will face Pacquiao, the holder of multiple world titles, on Saturday.

headline.main: Chris Algieri, a Boxer from Long Island, Says He’s Set for Manny Pacquiao
headline.print_headline: From Long Island, a Quick Rise to Face Pacquiao

docs.abstract: Profile of Chris Algieri, former kickboxer who is slated to face superstar Manny Pacquiao in Macau; Algieri has remained undefeated in his quick rise from an unknown boxer to a champion worthy of facing Pacquiao.
docs.snippet: Algieri, a 30-year-old former kickboxer who once pondered retirement, will face Pacquiao, the holder of multiple world titles, on Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Manny Pacquiao didn't need the huge bouquet of flowers he was holding to feel welcome in this gambling enclave, where he will be fighting at an odd hour Sunday against an opponent who has to already feel as though he won boxing's biggest lottery.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ted Karadenes is 67 and shares a one-bedroom apartment with two other men, subsisting on catering work and federal benefits. For his retirement, he plans to play music in subway stations.

headline.main: The Custodian of the Song in His Heart
headline.print_headline: The Custodian of the Song in His Heart

docs.abstract: Selfhelp Community Services, a beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York and one of seven charities supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides funds to Vietnam veteran Ted Karadenes to purchase an air conditioner for his Queens apartment.
docs.snippet: Ted Karadenes is 67 and shares a one-bedroom apartment with two other men, subsisting on catering work and federal benefits. For his retirement, he plans to play music in subway stations.
